result.execSummary:
The defendant Kelly E Powell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: with credit for 3 days time served.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable. Court ordered a payment plan in the amount of $25 per month commencing 3/3/16 and on the 3rd day of every month until paid in full.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections, included in the payment plan.

No firearms; weapons.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

timeConds.notes:
07-29-2016/ Judge Janet Protasiewicz
The Court ordered the remaining condition time is stayed.
Court grants agent to to allow modification of  No Contact order when appropriate. 



04-22-2016/ Judge Janet C Protasiewicz
Court amended JOC  to add 30 days STAYED condition time.
Defendant non-compliant with conditions of Probation.
The Court ordered the defendant taken into custody to spend 2 days, Straight Time, with NO Good Time credit, as condition time in the HOC
**  **  **  **  **  **

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kelly E Powell

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: reflects 07-29-2016 Court order staying condition time & allowing agent modification of No Contact order when appropriate
Court grants agent to allow modification of no contact order when appropriate.

Defendant Kelly E Powell in court with attorney Angel Johnson be behalf of attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Charles Kreger appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.
reflects 04-22-16 Court order adding 30 days of condition time and imposing 2 days of that time in the HOC

Defendant Kelly E Powell in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Porchia Sharese Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed. Court amended JOC to add 30 days STAYED condition time. Court admonished defendant for non-compliance and ordered defendant to serve 2 days of the condition time; straight time; forthwith.  Commitment For Condition Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed. Further review needed.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for July 29, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law. Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 
Defendant sentenced to serve 4 months in the House of Correction with credit for 3 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 1 year.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with victim.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable. Court ordered a payment plan in the amount of $25 per month commencing 3/3/16 and on the 3rd day of every month until paid in full.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections, included in the payment plan.
-No firearms; weapons.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 24. Jury trial date of 3/2/16 is vacated.

Defendant Kelly E Powell in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Jaclyn Schwartz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to defendant's statement, NOT complaint, as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
AS TO COUNT 2:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered count dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for April 22, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Kelly E Powell in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Porchia Sharese Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Case heard off the record.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed. Defense requests Plea and Sentencing date. Case remains set for Jury Trial on 3/2/2016. Case adjourned to branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 1, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed, Justice Point Report.

Final pre-trial at 02-17-2016 08:30 am.
Jury trial at 03-02-2016 08:30 am.

Defendant Kelly E Powell in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Porchia Sharese Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned to branch 24.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 17, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for March 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed, Justice Point Report.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Albertha E

Defendant Kelly E Powell in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Kelly E Powell in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 19, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
